dialogues.text: I uh... I feel that I need to uh --  there's something I feel I have to  say... I uh, I've never said this to  anyone before -- believe me, I've  stayed in horrible relationships for  years just so I wouldn't have to do  this, but I uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you trying to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just that I feel like it's maybe  not a good idea for us to keep going  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana sits down, staring ahead, stunned for a moment. Sudd she breaks down sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-I honestly never intended for this  to happen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please tell me it isn't that teenager!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enid and I were just friends. You  know... we feel comfortable around  each other... she really likes my  old records and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe this! I thought at  the very least a guy like you would  never pull this kind of shit on me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts crying again. Seymour awkwardly tries to comfo her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana, I... um...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana pushes him away violently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You disgusting pig! You're just an  overgrown baby who can't deal with a  woman your own age. You pathetic  weakling! You make me sick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enid is now utterly defeated. The phone rings. She lets t machine pick it up. Maxine enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I ask what you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know what you think you're  doing, staying out all night and  worrying your father to death!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, like he even noticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, young lady... I know you  don't like me -- I don't really care  whether you do or not -- but I will  not allow you to treat your father  the way you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear Seymour on the machine in the background...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really want to talk to you. I've  been thinking about what you said  about moving in here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can treat him any way I want to -  I'm an adult! Leave me alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maxine leaves. Seymour finishes his message. Enid picks u the phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enid & Rebecca sit at a table. Rebecca is wearing her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about the other day. I  don't know what's wrong with me...   I really do want to move in with  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I was thinking maybe  I should live alone. I decided to  rent that place we looked at. I'm  moving in next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please let me come with you. Please  please please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know - I'm not sure it's a  good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it's a good idea... it's  our plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how are you gonna pay rent and  everything? You don't even have a  job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get a job tomorrow, I promise.   If I don't, you can totally tell me  to fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enid is putting on her shoes. Her Dad opens the door slig and sticks his head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pumpkin, are you in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to yell at me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I heard about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in a horrible mood - tell her  not to worry, I'll be completely out  of her life in a few days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She understands what you're going  through and she really wants to help  you. She says that job at Computer  Station is still available if you  want it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-I'm not sure... yeah, maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I was just checking to see  if you were here - your friend Seymour  is on his way up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean "on his way up"!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just buzzed him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, three sharp KNOCKS on the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with you?! Tell him I'm  not here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I can't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUST DO IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad goes to answer the door. Enid hides in her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure when she'll be back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enid looks out the window and sees Seymour walking away. has a terribly sad look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seymour sits in dim light, dialing an antique "candlestic telephone. In the background, a Peter, Paul and Mary conc plays on the TV. We hear three rings followed by Enid's  answering machine message. He hangs up before it finishes Joe walks by the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, here's where the fun never  stops!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm really, really happy.   Really having a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still torturing yourself over that  Enid, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seymour doesn't answer. He looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where else am I ever going to find  another girl who likes Geeshie Wiley  records? (pause) She could at least have the decency  to call me back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she was just using you to try  and get back at some guy. Who knows?   It could be a million things. It's  wasted time trying to logically figure  out the female brain, that's for  sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again no answer from Seymour, he stares off into space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she's got another boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bummed out, wants  Joe to stop) Yeah, well... thanks for cheering me  up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan) No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seymour looks so miserable that even Joe has some compass for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at it this way - at least things  can't get any worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe leaves. Seymour is left listening to the record. INT. COOK'S CHICKEN HEADQUARTERS - DAY. Seymour is at work, walking down a carpeted hallway with  many doors on both sides. A door opens and a Tony Robbins ish, 35 year-old MANAGEMENT EXECUTIVE sticks his head out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seymour! Just the man I want to see.  Step in here for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seymour enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He plunks down the current issue of THE FREE WEEKLY - it' open to a 1/2 page article on page 8 with the headline "O Brother!" and a photo of THE PAINTING being removed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can you tell me about this,  Seymour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. ENID & REBECCA'S NEW APT. Enid is wearing a bright orange "Computer Station" T-shir and a yellow vest with a "trainee" tag. She's looking aro at her new home: a hopelessly drab, characterless apartme

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, whaddya think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where's all your stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enid points to a small box with sketchbook, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all you're bringing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna finish packing tonight...   I'll bring it over tomorrow sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure you're here by noon - we  have tons of stuff to do... Oh yeah!  I have to show you something else!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drags Enid into the kitchen and opens a BUILT-IN IRON BOARD as though it's the most amazing thing she's ever-se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't this the greatest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enid is sorting her stuff into boxes. Digging through her closet, she finds a box that she doesn't recognize. Insid are her old children's records (45's). She excitedly take one out and plays it. She folds her clothes while listeni to this song, which clearly is getting to her. She grabs  mechanically for the next thing hanging in her closet. It the uniform from her job at "Computer Station." She folds it, puts it in the box, then stops, staring at the orange fabric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca is nervously arranging and re-arranging her stuff She puts up her gigantic new kitchen wall clock and sets time to 12:45. She goes to the phone and calls Enid. The  machine picks up and Rebecca hangs up. She does another  tedious, pointless task. IT'S NOW 3:30. She's pissed off goes to the phone to call again. As it rings there's a kn on the door. Relieved, she hangs up and goes to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she opens the  door) What's wrong with you, retard - it's  three-thirty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Seymour standing there, not Enid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... hi. Uh... Enid's stepmother  told me I'd find her here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not at home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... they said she was here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is she doing?! She was  supposed to be here three hours ago!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, do you mind if I wait? I really  need to talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (allows him to step  inside but leaves  the door open) Are you sure she wasn't there?  Maybe  she was just hiding from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would she be hiding from me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... where is she, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she's with Josh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh!? Why would she be with Josh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? What did she tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just mentioned him a few times  and said that they had been dating -  I thought maybe she was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Is she having some secret affair  with Josh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea - I just want to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why wouldn't she tell me? There's no  way! She could never keep that to  herself... you're crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, I don't know enough about it  to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That slut!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (changing subject  back to me) Why did you say she might be hiding  from me? Did she say anything to you  about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting revenge on  Seymour) Yeah, she thinks you're a dork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, what do you expect?  Considering  how we met you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On that pathetic fake blind date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't she ever tell you about that?  God, she really is pathological...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What fake blind date? What are you  talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca goes over and gets Enid's sketchbook out of the b and flips through it. When she gets to the right page she hands it to Seymour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Read it and weep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a pasted-up PERSONAL AD beside a DRAWING OF SEYMOU in Wowsville. On the facing page we see a drawing of JOSH with his name surrounded by RED HEARTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seymour's car screeches into the parking lot. He bursts i the store, ready for once in his life to make a scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh is behind the counter cleaning the Slurpee machine,  with his back to the entrance, as Seymour storms in. Doug over by the magazine rack reading a dirt bike magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you had a good laugh at my  expense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh turns around - what's going on? He recognizes Seymou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh... oh... hi... uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to see something funny?   I'll show you something funny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he says this he flips over a SMALL DISPLAY RACK of pot chips. Then he tries to flip over a BIG DISPLAY CASE in f of the counter but is unable to budge it - he keeps tryin and gets more and more frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh runs from behind the counter to stop him before he  creates a huge mess. He tries to grab Seymour and they ge into a ridiculous frantic scuffle. Seymour starts yelling Suddenly Doug appears and gets Seymour in a choke hold wi his nunchucks. Doug ad-libs cop-style jargon. Josh is fre out. Seymour realizes what a fool he is and starts to cry The Boss comes out of the back room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh! What going on here?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. ENID & REBECCA'S APARTMENT - AROUND MIDNIGHT The apartment is dark - lit only by a harsh, annoying  streetlight. Rebecca sits on the couch in sweat clothes,  exasperated. She goes to look out the window. Cars with l radios can be heard driving by. She goes to the phone - s checks it and hangs up. Pause. She picks it up again - on last try. She dials the number and waits. We hear the BEE of the answering machine. Rebecca hangs up. She gets into a sleeping bag (spread out in the center of cold linoleum floor). She zips the zipper all the way ove her head and curls up into a whimpering ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TITLE CARD: "SEVERAL MONTHS LATER"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dialogue begins in voice-over as the title card fades We slowly fade in to see Seymour, lying on a pink pastel  psychiatrist's couch, as he speaks to his THERAPIST, a  handsome, well-coiffed woman in her late 40s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to admit, things have really  started looking up for me since my  life turned to shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me more about this job.   What exactly will you be doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, mostly archival research,  cataloguing old records and writing  liner notes for their CD reissues.   It's really... I can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember what I said when we first  started -- this little breakdown  might turn out to be the best thing  that ever happened to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't pay very much, but I should  be able to afford my own place in a  few months... Do you think that's  too soon? I'm really anxious to get  my record collection out of storage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we start with that next  week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seymour looks up. She nods toward the large wall clock be her: thirty seconds after five. Re gets up and she walks slowly toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she opens the  door) Don't thank me. You're doing all the  work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause. They stand facing each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seymour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a check for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seymour takes a filled-out check from his shirt pocket. I the waiting room, we see SEYMOUR'S MOTHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seymour? Are you done? Did you have  a chance to think about what you  might want for dinner while you were  in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can talk about it in the car,  Ma...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they leave Seymour looks back and smiles weakly at the doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cafe has been FULLY REMODELED and now resembles Wowsv more than the old Quality Cafe. There are no neighborhood "characters" anymore, only well-heeled twenty-somethings. see that Rebecca is now a waitress here. She tears off a  check and places it in front of a super-muscular, polo sh EUROPEAN HIPSTER, who is too busy tapping away at his  POWERBOOK to notice. She walks toward the end of the counter to total up her  receipts. She looks up and sees Enid, wearing tasteful 19 style clothes, sitting across from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi... I almost didn't recognize  you -- I think I need to get glasses;  you're all blurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding toward  muscular HIPSTER) You're lucky then, you can't see the  veins on that guy's biceps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, he's a really nice guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see at this point that Rebecca & Enid are no longe friends, but there are also no hard feelings evident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe an orange juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca goes to get it. Enid looks around, bemused and  saddened by what The Quality Cafe has become.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look what I got...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a crumpled envelope from her pocket and pulls o her DIPLOMA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow... finally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just came yesterday...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. Josh enters. Enid turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Enid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Josh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment it's not clear who he's talking to, and then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still counting  receipts) Yeah, just one second...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finishes, takes off her apron and emerges from behind the counter. She kisses Josh perfunctorily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Josh) Did you remember to pay the phone  bill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Enid) Call me sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely. We still have to go to  that shoe store sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca & Josh leave. Enid is totally alone in the no world of the Quality Cafe. A momentary pause as she calml stares into her orange juice. We see a small, round TRAVE BAG at her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Enid walking down the familiar streets of her worl It's early evening, quiet except for distant street noise She walks toward the old ACME SHOES AND REPAIR STORE. It  looks the same, miraculously preserved, until she stands  right in front of it. She looks through the partially pap over window and sees WORKMEN inside installing new fixtur a modern counter and several small tables, all made from FAMILIAR GREEN PLASTIC. A sign in the window reads: "Comi Soon: Another COFFEE EXPERIENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues walking as the sun has set and there is a c stillness to the city. She turns a corner and is startled her reflection in a large window made of one-way glass. S stops and looks at herself. Everything about her looks pe for once; no need to change a thing. She moves closer to glass and, shading her eyes, tries to look inside. She continues walking. Darkness is just setting in and sh has the street all to herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Enid at NORMAN'S BUS STOP, sitting on the bench. S looks at the apartment building across the street. A woma who has just arrived home from work turns on the TV, bath her living room with that EERIE BLUE LIGHT. The same thin happens in another window down the street... then another Enid looks down the street. In the distance A BUS rounds corner and heads toward her. From a third-story window across the street, we see the b as it arrives and stops, blocking Enid from view. A momen later it pulls away, leaving an empty bench. The CAMERA m upward, farther and farther away as the music swells and credits roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus disappears over the crest of the bridge.
